'''Aelinor Targaryen''' is an unseen character in ''[[Game of Thrones (TV series)|Game of Thrones]]''. She is not expected to appear in the series, being long dead by the time it begins.
sections.Family tree: {{House Targaryen family tree Blackfyre Rebellion era}}
sections.In the books: In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, Aelinor is not mentioned precisely as Aerys I's sister-wife, though it was assumed by fandom she was a Targaryen due to the custom of dynastic incest. In ''The World of Ice and Fire'', however, it is revealed she was a member of House Penrose, a noble house from [[the Stormlands]], as well as a cousin to [[House Targaryen]].
sections.Biography:
===Background===
Aelinor Targaryen was the only daughter of King [[Daeron II Targaryen|Daeron the Good]] and Queen [[Myriah Martell|Myriah]]. Per the Targaryen tradition, she married her brother, King [[Aerys I Targaryen|Aerys]]. Her other brothers were [[Baelor Targaryen (son of Daeron II)|Baelor]], [[Rhaegel Targaryen|Rhaegel]], and [[Maekar Targaryen|Maekar]].

===[[Season 1]]===
Aelinor, along with her brothers, is mentioned in the [[House Targaryen]]'s entry of the book ''[[The Lineages and Histories of the Great Houses of the Seven Kingdoms]]''.<ref>"[[A Golden Crown]]"</ref>
